content.en: HIV-1 Analysis: New algorithms are being used to study various aspects of HIV-1 infection. These algorithms can identify sites of positive selection in the virus genome, individuals with broad and potent neutralizing antibody responses, predict coreceptor use in primary cells, examine HIV-1 envelope evolution, study viral evolution and immune escape, and detect compensatory mutations. They are also used to analyze the selective forces on T-cell epitopes, study coreceptor usage in different HIV-1 subtypes, identify epitopes that activate regulatory T cells, evaluate viral evolution and immune escape, analyze viral populations, determine post-transmission mutations associated with immune escape, and identify potential immune escape mutations in HIV-1 strains. These algorithms are helping researchers gain a better understanding of HIV-1 and develop more effective strategies for prevention and treatment.
content.da: HIV-1 Analyse: Nye algoritmer bliver brugt til at studere forskellige aspekter af HIV-1 infektion. Disse algoritmer kan identificere steder med positiv selektion i virusets genom, individer med bred og potent neutraliserende antistofrespons, forudsige coreceptorbrug i primærceller, undersøge HIV-1 envelopevolution, studere viral evolution og immunflugt, og detektere kompenserende mutationer. De bruges også til at analysere selektive kræfter på T-celleepitoper, studere coreceptorbrug i forskellige HIV-1 subtyper, identificere epitoper der aktiverer regulatoriske T-celler, evaluere viral evolution og immunflugt, analysere virale populationer, bestemme mutationer efter transmission forbundet med immunflugt, og identificere potentielle immunflugtsmutationer i HIV-1 stammer. Disse algoritmer hjælper forskere med at få en bedre forståelse af HIV-1 og udvikle mere effektive strategier for forebyggelse og behandling.
